@Namespace(uri="http://www.xchain.org/hibernate/1.0")

Package org.xchain.namespaces.hibernate

This namespace provides access to hibernate.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractQueryCommand
    Base query command class.
    AbstractQueryResultCommand
    Base query result command.
    AbstractSessionCommand
    Base session command class.
    Constants  
    DebugSessionCommand  
    DeleteCommand
    The delete command deletes the provided entity or list of entities.
    FirstResultCommand
    The first-result command sets the FirstResult on the parent Query.
    GetCommand
    The get command starts executes the Get method on the current session.
    IterateCommand
    The iterate evaluates the Query as an iterator.
    ListCommand
    The list evaluates the Query as a list.
    MaxResultCommand
    The max-result command sets the MaxResults on the parent Query.
    ParameterCommand
    The parameter command will specify a parameter for a query.
    PersistCommand
    The persist command will execute a Hibernate persist on the session with the specified entity.
    QueryCommand
    The query command starts a new query.
    SaveCommand
    The save command will execute a Hibernate save on the session with the specified entity.
    SessionCommand
    NOTE: The hibernate session command is currently broken.
    TransactionCommand
    The transaction command starts a Hibernate transaction.
    UniqueResultCommand
    The unique-result evaluates a query as a uniqueResult.
    UpdateCommand
    The update executes the query as an update.
    ValidateCommand
    The validate command ensures that objects have their proper hibernate restrictions.
    ValidateCommand.InvalidClause
    The invalid command chain is executed if the parent validation command fails.
    ValidateCommand.ValidClause
    The valid command chain is executed if the parent validation command passes.

Package org.xchain.namespaces.hibernate Description

This namespace provides access to hibernate. A hibernate.cfg.xml must be present to properly establish a connection to a datasource.

Most hibernate commands are required to be within an active session.

Author:
Mike Moulton, Christian Trimble, Devon Tackett
